meanings.definition: Laugh nervously or in a restrained manner.
meanings.sent1: She was tittering during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: The girls were tittering at the back of the classroom.
meanings.sent3: His tittering made the atmosphere lighter.
meanings.sent4: The tittering in the library was like a soft melody.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tittering echoed in the hallway.

meanings.definition: Make a series of short, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The birds were tittering in the trees.
meanings.sent2: Children tittering with excitement at the party.
meanings.sent3: The tittering of the kittens was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the leaves tittering in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The tittering of the stream was soothing.
